name: Wizard
description: Scholars of arcane magic, capable of manipulating the structures of reality.

1.name: Spellcasting
1.description: As a student of arcane magic, you have a spellbook containing spells that show the first glimmerings of your true power. You can cast wizard spells using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability.

1.name: Arcane Recovery
1.description: You have learned to regain some of your magical energy by studying your spellbook. Once per day when you finish a short rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your wizard level (rounded up), and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher.

2.name: Arcane Tradition
2.description: You choose an arcane tradition, shaping your practice of magic through one of eight schools: Abjuration, Conjuration, Divination, Enchantment, Evocation, Illusion, Necromancy, or Transmutation. Your choice grants you features at 2nd level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

6.name: Arcane Tradition Feature
6.description: You gain a feature from your Arcane Tradition.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

10.name: Arcane Tradition Feature
10.description: You gain a feature from your Arcane Tradition.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

14.name: Arcane Tradition Feature
14.description: You gain a feature from your Arcane Tradition.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

18.name: Spell Mastery
18.description: You have achieved such mastery over certain spells that you can cast them at will. Choose a 1st-level wizard spell and a 2nd-level wizard spell that are in your spellbook. You can cast those spells at their lowest level without expending a spell slot when you have them prepared. If you want to cast either spell at a higher level, you must expend a spell slot as normal.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

20.name: Signature Spells
20.description: You gain mastery over two powerful spells and can cast them with little effort. Choose two 3rd-level wizard spells in your spellbook as your signature spells. You always have these spells prepared, they don't count against the number of spells you have prepared, and you can cast each of them once at 3rd level without expending a spell slot. When you do so, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

options.name: School of Abjuration
options.description: The School of Abjuration emphasizes magic that blocks, banishes, or protects.

2.name: Abjuration Savant
2.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy an abjuration spell into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Arcane Ward
2.description: You can weave magic around yourself for protection. When you cast an abjuration spell of 1st level or higher, you can simultaneously use a strand of the spell's magic to create a magical ward on yourself that lasts until you finish a long rest. The ward has hit points equal to twice your wizard level + your Intelligence modifier.

6.name: Projected Ward
6.description: When a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to cause your Arcane Ward to absorb that damage.

10.name: Improved Abjuration
10.description: When you cast an abjuration spell that requires you to make an ability check as part of casting that spell, you add your proficiency bonus to that ability check.

14.name: Spell Resistance
14.description: You have advantage on saving throws against spells. Furthermore, you have resistance against the damage of spells.

options.name: School of Evocation
options.description: You focus your study on magic that creates powerful elemental effects.

2.name: Evocation Savant
2.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy an evocation spell into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Sculpt Spells
2.description: You can create pockets of relative safety within the effects of your evocation spells. When you cast an evocation spell that affects other creatures that you can see, you can choose a number of them equal to 1 + the spell's level. The chosen creatures automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell, and they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save.

6.name: Potent Cantrip
6.description: Your damaging cantrips affect even creatures that avoid the brunt of the effect. When a creature succeeds on a saving throw against your cantrip, the creature takes half the cantrip's damage (if any) but suffers no additional effect from the cantrip.

10.name: Empowered Evocation
10.description: You can add your Intelligence modifier to one damage roll of any wizard evocation spell you cast.

14.name: Overchannel
14.description: You can increase the power of your simpler spells. When you cast a wizard spell of 1st through 5th level that deals damage, you can deal maximum damage with that spell. The first time you do so, you suffer no adverse effect. If you use this feature again before you finish a long rest, you take 2d12 necrotic damage for each level of the spell, immediately after you cast it. Each time you use this feature again before finishing a long rest, the necrotic damage per spell level increases by 1d12.

options.name: School of Conjuration
options.description: You focus on the study of summoning creatures and objects to your aid.

2.name: Conjuration Savant
2.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy a conjuration spell into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Minor Conjuration
2.description: You can use your action to conjure up an inanimate object in your hand or on the ground in an unoccupied space that you can see within 10 feet of you.

6.name: Benign Transposition
6.description: You can use your action to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see. Alternatively, you can choose a willing creature within 30 feet and swap places with it.

10.name: Focused Conjuration
10.description: While you are concentrating on a conjuration spell, your concentration can't be broken as a result of taking damage.

14.name: Durable Summons
14.description: Any creature that you summon or create with a conjuration spell has 30 temporary hit points.

options.name: School of Divination
options.description: The counsel of diviners is sought by royalty and commoners alike, for all seek to know what the future holds.

2.name: Divination Savant
2.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy a divination spell into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Portent
2.description: When you finish a long rest, roll two d20s and record the numbers rolled. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with one of these foretelling rolls.

6.name: Expert Divination
6.description: When you cast a divination spell of 2nd level or higher using a spell slot, you regain one expended spell slot of a lower level.

10.name: The Third Eye
10.description: You can use your action to gain one of the following benefits: darkvision, ethereal sight, greater comprehension, or see invisibility.

14.name: Greater Portent
14.description: You roll three d20s for your Portent feature, instead of two.

options.name: School of Enchantment
options.description: You have honed your ability to magically entrance and beguile other people and monsters.

2.name: Enchantment Savant
2.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy an enchantment spell into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Hypnotic Gaze
2.description: Your soft words and enchanting gaze can magically enthrall another creature you can see within 5 feet of you.

6.name: Instinctive Charm
6.description: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to divert the attack to another creature within range.

10.name: Split Enchantment
10.description: When you cast an enchantment spell of 1st level or higher that targets only one creature, you can have it target a second creature.

14.name: Alter Memories
14.description: When you cast an enchantment spell to charm one or more creatures, you can alter one creature's understanding so that it remains unaware of being charmed.

options.name: School of Illusion
options.description: You focus your studies on magic that dazzles the senses, befuddles the mind, and tricks even the wisest folk.

2.name: Illusion Savant
2.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy an illusion spell into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Improved Minor Illusion
2.description: You learn the minor illusion cantrip if you don't already know it, and you can create both a sound and an image with a single casting of minor illusion.

6.name: Malleable Illusions
6.description: When you cast an illusion spell that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can use your action to change the nature of that illusion.

10.name: Illusory Self
10.description: You can create an illusory duplicate of yourself as an instant, almost instinctive reaction to danger.

14.name: Illusory Reality
14.description: You have learned the secret of weaving shadow magic into your illusions to give them a semi-reality.

options.name: School of Necromancy
options.description: You focus your study on magic that creates powerful necrotic effects and manipulates the energies of life and death.

2.name: Necromancy Savant
2.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy a necromancy spell into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Grim Harvest
2.description: Once per turn when you kill one or more creatures with a spell of 1st level or higher, you regain hit points equal to twice the spell's level, or three times its level if the spell belongs to the School of Necromancy.

6.name: Undead Thralls
6.description: You add animate dead to your spellbook if you don't already have it. When you cast animate dead, you can target one additional corpse or pile of bones, creating another zombie or skeleton, as appropriate.

10.name: Inured to Undeath
10.description: You have resistance to necrotic damage, and your hit point maximum can't be reduced.

14.name: Command Undead
14.description: You can use magic to bring undead under your control, even those created by other wizards.

options.name: School of Transmutation
options.description: You are a student of spells that modify energy and matter. To you, the world is not a fixed thing, but eminently mutable.

2.name: Transmutation Savant
2.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy a transmutation spell into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Minor Alchemy
2.description: You can temporarily alter the physical properties of one nonmagical object, changing it from one substance into another.

6.name: Transmuter's Stone
6.description: You can spend 8 hours creating a transmuter's stone that stores transmutation magic.

10.name: Shapechanger
10.description: You add the polymorph spell to your spellbook, if it is not there already. You can cast polymorph without expending a spell slot to transform yourself into a beast whose challenge rating is equal to or less than your level divided by 2 (rounded down).

14.name: Master Transmuter
14.description: You can use your action to consume the reserve of transmutation magic stored within your transmuter's stone in a single burst.

options.name: School of War Magic
options.description: A tradition of wizardry that blends the practices of evocation and abjuration to create a potent combination of defensive and offensive spellcasting.

2.name: Arcane Deflection
2.description: When you are hit by an attack or fail a saving throw, you can use your reaction to gain a bonus to AC or saving throw.

2.name: Tactical Wit
2.description: You gain a bonus to your initiative equal to your Intelligence modifier.

6.name: Power Surge
6.description: You can store magical energy when you counter or dispel magic, which you can release to empower your damaging spells.

10.name: Durable Magic
10.description: While you maintain concentration on a spell, you gain a bonus to AC and all saving throws.

14.name: Deflecting Shroud
14.description: When you use Arcane Deflection, you can cause magical energy to arc from you to nearby creatures.

options.name: School of Bladesinging
options.description: A tradition of wizardry that incorporates swordplay and dance, practiced by elves.

2.name: Training in War and Song
2.description: You gain proficiency with light armor, one type of one-handed melee weapon of your choice, and the Performance skill.

2.name: Bladesong
2.description: You can invoke a secret elven magic called the Bladesong, enhancing your combat abilities.

6.name: Extra Attack
6.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

10.name: Song of Defense
10.description: You can direct your magic to absorb damage while your Bladesong is active.

14.name: Song of Victory
14.description: You add your Intelligence modifier to the damage of your melee weapon attacks while your Bladesong is active.

options.name: School of Chronurgy
options.description: You focus your studies on the manipulation of time itself, seeking to alter the flow of the multiverse's timeline in favor of your desired outcome.

2.name: Chronal Shift
2.description: You can magically alter time around a creature, forcing them to reroll an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.

2.name: Temporal Awareness
2.description: You gain a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Intelligence modifier.

6.name: Momentary Stasis
6.description: As an action, you can magically force a creature into a temporary stasis.

10.name: Arcane Abeyance
10.description: When you cast a spell, you can store it in a tiny bead for later use.

14.name: Convergent Future
14.description: You can peer through possible futures and magically pull one of them into events around you.

options.name: School of Graviturgy
options.description: Your studies have unlocked the ability to manipulate gravity itself, bending space and mass to your will.

2.name: Adjust Density
2.description: As an action, you can magically alter the weight of a creature or object.

6.name: Gravity Well
6.description: When you cast a spell that imposes the prone condition or deals damage, you can move the target closer to or away from you.

10.name: Violent Attraction
10.description: When another creature deals damage to a target within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to increase that damage.

14.name: Event Horizon
14.description: As an action, you can create a powerful gravitational field that warps space around a point you can see.

options.name: Order of Scribes
options.description: Your scholarly research has uncovered unique methods of spellcasting, allowing you to magically write and manipulate the physical nature of your spells.

2.name: Wizardly Quill
2.description: You can create a magical quill that doesn't require ink and can transcribe spells more quickly.

2.name: Awakened Spellbook
2.description: Your spellbook becomes a repository of your magical knowledge, allowing you to alter the nature of your spells.

6.name: Master Scrivener
6.description: You can create spell scrolls more quickly and at reduced cost.

10.name: Manifest Mind
10.description: You can manifest the mind of your Awakened Spellbook as a tiny spectral object.

14.name: One with the Word
14.description: Your connection to your spellbook allows you to cheat death and transport yourself through its pages.
